summary: This is a grand jury transcript from June 29, 2020, in the Southern District of New York, concerning the investigation of Ghislaine Maxwell. An FBI Special Agent from the Violent Crimes against Children squad testifies about the investigation, detailing allegations from three victims (referred to as Victim-1, Victim-2, and Victim-3) regarding sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein with Maxwell's involvement, grooming patterns, travel on Epstein's private jet, and evidence from searches of Epstein's properties. The agent also discusses Maxwell's 2016 deposition testimony in a defamation lawsuit where she denied knowledge of underage massages and sex toys.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the grand jury proceeding. The agent testifies about her romantic and professional relationship with Jeffrey Epstein, her role in managing his properties, grooming minors, and participating in or facilitating sexual abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier. The agent describes him as a multimillionaire who owned properties in New York, Palm Beach, and New Mexico, and a private jet. He is accused of sexually abusing multiple minor girls, with Maxwell's assistance.

persons.name: FBI Special Agent
persons.context: The witness testifying before the grand jury. She works on the Violent Crimes against Children squad and has participated in the investigation of Ghislaine Maxwell, interviewing witnesses and reviewing documents.

persons.name: Victim-1
persons.context: A woman who was allegedly abused by Epstein and Maxwell from ages 14 to 17, starting after meeting them at Interlochen summer camp in 1994. She is referred to as Victim 1 in the proposed indictment.

persons.name: Victim-2
persons.context: A woman who was allegedly abused by Epstein and Maxwell starting around age 16 in 1996. She is referred to as Victim 2 in the proposed indictment.

persons.name: Victim-3
persons.context: A woman from England who was allegedly introduced to Epstein by Maxwell around age 17 in 1994/1995 and sexually abused. She is referred to as Victim 3 in the proposed indictment.

persons.name: Epstein's House Manager
persons.context: A former employee of Epstein in Palm Beach who started in the early 1990s. He was interviewed twice and described Maxwell's demanding nature, changes in house rules, and observed interactions with Victim-1.

persons.name: Epstein's Pilot
persons.context: A former pilot for Epstein's private jet in the 1990s. He was interviewed and recalled Victim-1 traveling on the jet but not specific flight details.

persons.name: Victim-1's Childhood Friend
persons.context: A friend of Victim-1 from Interlochen camp and high school. He was interviewed and recalled Victim-1 talking about spending time with Epstein and Maxwell, and meeting Maxwell once.

persons.name: Victim-2's Sister
persons.context: Victim-2's older sister who worked for Epstein in New York. She facilitated Victim-2's initial meeting with Epstein.

persons.name: Virginia Giuffre
persons.context: Referenced as the plaintiff 'Giuffre' in a 2015 defamation lawsuit against Maxwell. The lawsuit stemmed from Maxwell calling Giuffre a liar after Giuffre alleged sexual abuse by Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The attorney questioning the FBI Special Agent during the grand jury proceeding.

connections.description: Had a romantic relationship, and Maxwell worked for Epstein managing his homes and staff. Described as one of his closest associates in the 1990s.
Maxwell met Victim-1 at age 13/14, groomed her, acted like a 'cool older sister', facilitated her travel and abuse, and was present during group sexualized massages.
Epstein sexually abused Victim-1 from ages 14 to 17, including at his properties in Palm Beach and New York, and provided her financial assistance.
Maxwell met Victim-2 in New Mexico when Victim-2 was 16, was charming, gave her a tour, took her shopping, instructed her to give Epstein foot massages, and gave her a nude massage.
Epstein sexually touched Victim-2 during movies and got into her bed to 'cuddle' during a trip to New Mexico when she was 16.
Maxwell met Victim-3 around age 17, treated her 'like naughty school girls', introduced her to Epstein for massages, and facilitated her travel and abuse.
Epstein sexually abused Victim-3 during massages, including using a vibrator, and gave her cash. Abuse occurred during trips to various locations.
Maxwell was demanding and on top of the house manager all the time after she arrived on the scene. He described her as a 'bitch' and said she gave him orders, including to pick up Victim-1.
The house manager worked for Epstein from the early 1990s, managing the Palm Beach house. He cleaned the massage room and found sex toys.
Sisters. The older sister worked for Epstein and arranged for Victim-2 to meet him, suggesting he could help with college.
Victim-2's sister worked for Epstein in New York.

events.title: Meeting at Interlochen Camp
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell meet Victim-1 (age 13/14) at the Interlochen Center for the Arts summer camp in Michigan. Epstein was a donor and had donated a scholarship lodge.

events.title: Sexual Abuse of Victim-1
events.description: Victim-1 is regularly sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein, with Ghislaine Maxwell's involvement, at Epstein's properties in Palm Beach and New York City. Abuse includes massages, digital penetration, use of vibrators, and group encounters.

events.title: Victim-2's First Meeting with Epstein
events.description: Victim-2 (age 16) flies to New York City, meets Jeffrey Epstein at his townhouse through her sister, and Epstein touches her inappropriately at the movies.

events.title: Victim-2's Trip to New Mexico Ranch
events.description: Victim-2 (age 16) travels to Epstein's Zorro Ranch in New Mexico. Maxwell instructs her to give Epstein foot massages, gives her a nude massage, and Epstein gets into her bed to 'cuddle'.

events.title: Victim-3 Introduced to Epstein
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell introduces Victim-3 (age 17) to Jeffrey Epstein in London. During their first meeting, Maxwell asks Victim-3 to give Epstein a massage, which leads to sexual assault.

events.title: Palm Beach Police Search
events.description: Palm Beach Police execute a search warrant at Epstein's Palm Beach house, finding massage tables, sex toys, and a signed photograph of Victim-1.

events.title: Maxwell's Deposition Testimony
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gives sworn deposition testimony in the Virginia Giuffre defamation lawsuit. She denies knowledge of a scheme to recruit underage girls for massages and denies giving anyone a massage.

events.title: FBI Search of Epstein's NY Townhouse
events.description: The FBI executes a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan townhouse, finding a massage room with sex toys, handcuffs, a whip, nude photographs, and a school-girl outfit.

events.title: Grand Jury Testimony
events.description: An FBI Special Agent testifies before the grand jury about the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing allegations from three victims and evidence against Maxwell.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's townhouse)
358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's waterfront estate)
49 Zorro Ranch Road, Stanley, New Mexico (Epstein's ranch)
Interlochen Center for the Arts, Michigan
keyFacts: An FBI agent testified that three victims (Victim-1, Victim-2, Victim-3) alleged they were sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein as minors, with Ghislaine Maxwell playing a key role in grooming, facilitating, and sometimes participating in the abuse.

The agent described a pattern of grooming where Epstein and Maxwell would meet girls, gain their and their parents' trust through financial assistance and mentorship, and then escalate to sexual abuse, often in the context of 'massages'.

Flight logs for Epstein's private jet from the 1990s were entered as evidence, showing flights with passengers including Epstein, Maxwell (initials G.M.), and Victim-1 (listed by name) to locations like Traverse City, Michigan (near Interlochen), Teterboro, NJ, and Santa Fe, NM.

The agent testified that Maxwell gave sworn deposition testimony in 2016 where she denied knowledge of underage massages, denied possessing or knowing about sex toys at Epstein's properties, and denied giving anyone a massageâ€”statements contradicted by witness accounts and evidence.

Evidence from law enforcement searches in 2005 (Palm Beach) and 2019 (NYC) of Epstein's properties found massage tables, sex toys (including vibrators, dildos, handcuffs), nude photographs of young females, and a school-girl outfit, corroborating victim accounts.
